headline: Big Spenders on Small Screens Worry as Digital Backlash Grows
abstract: Companies spent $99 billion on mobile ads last year even as some made commercials that acknowledge the downside of smartphones.
lead_paragraph: People are growing weary of the constant stream of alerts on their phones and struggling to make it through a meal without checking their screens. Theyâ€™re worried about being tracked. They have tech neck, and it hurts.
